channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Couples most likely to divorce share a common economic trait, research shows
item.description: Female breadwinners represent just 16% of all U.S. households—but account for 42% of divorces

item.title: Trump Administration Must Rehire Thousands of Fired Workers, Judges Rule
item.description: A federal judge called the administration’s justification for the firings of workers with probationary status a “sham.” Another ruling barred the admi...

item.title: Tech leaders at Anthropic, IBM, and Meta warn that AI is coming for software developer jobs
item.description: While AI is set to transform the field of software development, executives disagree on the timing and scale.

item.title: Dr. Oz’s Journey From Heart Doctor to Celebrity to Iconoclast
item.description: A once-respected surgeon found fame and fortune as medicine’s biggest iconoclast. Now he’s on the cusp of power to help shape American public health.

item.title: Amid Trump’s latest tariff threats, the S&P 500 tumbles into correction territory just three weeks after smashing record highs
item.description: The index dipped 1.4%, while the Nasdaq Composite and the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 2% and 1.3%, respectively, on Thursday.

item.title: Trump Demands Major Changes in Columbia Discipline and Admissions Rules
item.description: A letter outlining “immediate next steps” arrived less than a week after the administration said it was canceling $400 million in grants and contracts...

item.title: Putin Stops Far Short of Agreeing to a Cease-Fire, and Adds Tough Conditions
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said the Russian leader had no desire to end the war, proposing conditions that made a truce unattainable.

item.title: In Japan, a Journalist Takes a Stand by Striking Out on His Own
item.description: Makoto Watanabe quit a major newspaper after it retracted a scoop. Now he runs an investigative nonprofit that does not shy away from challenging auth...

item.title: Beyond Concorde: One man’s quest to bring back supersonic travel becomes reality
item.description: When British Airways retired its Concorde fleet in 2003, few imagined that would be the demise of supersonic passenger travel for the foreseeable futu...

item.title: Europe Expected a Transactional Trump. It Got Something Else.
item.description: Europe had been banking on a United States that wanted to make a deal on tariffs and trade. With little progress in that direction, it’s reluctantly s...

item.title: Video: Blood Moon Total Lunar Eclipse: When and How to Watch
item.description: Earth’s shadow will block most of the light that illuminates the lunar surface, creating what is known as a blood moon.

item.title: How Zelensky Can Help Ukraine
item.description: Different sides of the war in Ukraine reach for different, simple narratives about Mr. Zelensky. The truth has always been more complicated.

item.title: Outrage in Australia After American Woman Grabs a Baby Wombat
item.description: A video of an American woman snatching a baby wombat from the side of its mother enraged many in Australia. She left the country Friday.

item.title: Friday Briefing
item.description: Vladimir Putin’s conditions for a cease-fire.

item.title: U.S. household net worth climbed to record at end of 2024
item.description: However, stocks have mostly reversed course in recent weeks, wiping out $5 trillion in gains.
